column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$2$5$On and off
column3: Mostly on for 3 or so years. 1stly
column4: effects were noticed by others before noticed by myself. Weight loss due to loss of appetite and then mild weight gain once I started feeling a little more care free. This 'drug' definitely helped with my anxiety. It made me overall very positive. Not 100% better but way more bearable. Helped with getting angry. All was great until I started to continuously notice this lack of empathy
column5: cloudiness In what felt like my frontal lobe
column6: my sex drive severely dropped
column7: and then this major suicidal depression came like a freight train for some reason. Honestly It bummed me out but I knew getting off it was for the better. Now that I have been off of it for a few months
column8: I like the natural feeling better. I think. My anxiety is back but I feel like I can deal with it better. My thoughts come easier. My memory is better.. It feels more 'real.'  However I still have a depressing cloud that lingers over me But SO much better then what was happening to me towards the end. I miss not getting angry so easy and the ease of having positive thoughts. However Im hoping that this experience has helped me learn how to balance things on my own without the help of a prescription. Overall it 'worked great
column9: ' My dosage might have needed to be changed. It could be the stressful but Im confident that being off medication is more the type of life I wanna live.

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was experiencing long term problems with anxiety and depression that I finally realized required medical help. After discussing the problems I was dealing with
column3: my doctor prescribed 10mg of citalopram for me with instructions for a return consult in a couple weeks. I felt a little sedated at first but also much more at ease and less depressed. Wife quickly noticed the difference in my demeanor as well and now makes sure that I take the medication on schedule. I had some minor GI upset initially which dissipated. The only other problem with taking the drug was when my doctor increased the dose to 20mg
column4: which caused some sexual difficulties. After contacting my doctor
column5: I was instructed to reduce the dose back to 10mg a day or two before sex might be expected and then back to the 20mg dosage afterwards. I know
column6: this disrupts spontaneity but the overall tradeoff is well worth it for both me and my wife. We're both very happy with the results of the drug.

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$Before starting this medication I was very nervous about the potential side effects I read about online and other users negative reviews. I have now been on celexa (citalopram 20 mg) for a little over a month and I haven't experienced any negative side effects other than drowsiness after taking the medication. I take it before going to sleep at night so that it does not affect my daily routine. It wasn't until about the 4th week that I began to notice that my anxiety had decreased significantly. I used to become completely overcome with anxiety and worrying almost daily and I have now gone an entire week without becoming anxious at all. I do still experience anxious thoughts on occasion but I am now able to redirect my thinking and let them go rather than obsessively focusing on them and becoming depressed. I have never reviewed anything like this before but as there are so many bad reviews out there I thought it was important to let people know that my experience has been nothing but positive.

I have noticed that things that were bothering me do not as much now

column2: 19-24 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I've been taking Celexa for almost 6 months now and it has been a blessing for me. I take 40 mg every night right before bed and it has helped control my anxiety and depression. I have had anxiety and depression and have been medicated for as long as I can remember. Celexa has been the best medicine for me so far and I have been on plenty of other anxiety and depression medicines. I notice when something begins to upset me or stresses me out
column3: I become slightly dizzy and it feels a little like I'm having an out of body experience to the slightest degree. The feeling and dizziness fade quickly once I'm able to calm down. It's nothing horrible and it doesn't bother me much because the good effects from this medicine outweigh this side effect. I don't have the ""numb"" feeling that everybody talks about. I still feel happy
column4: sad
column5: and angry like I should. I'm just able to get through my days without the crippling effects of anxiety and depression. It was a little hard for me the first few weeks because I was convinced it wasn't working and I felt like my anxiety was actually increasing. But I stuck with it faithfully and at about 6 weeks
column6: I started to feel pretty good. I stopped having so many anxiety episodes during the day and I noticed I was a slightly bit more optimistic about life. I knew it was FINALLY starting to help and it has continually helped me more and more the longer I have stuck with it. I know Celexa isn't for everybody but it's been a literal life saver for me and I'm pleased with the mental progress I've been able to make since being on it. "

19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$5$"I took this medication for about 3 months to treat my anxiety and depression. The first two months I had a lot of nausea always about 1 hour after taking celexa
column3: however
column4: it worked amazing to relieve my anxiety and depression. For the first time in years
column5: I was able to relax and was happy. After the second month though
column6: I just began to feel numb. I didn't care about anything. Things that used to upset me no longer did
column7: but things that used to make me smile didn't affect me either. But my depression prior was severe
column8: so I stayed on it and focused on learning about myself and how unreasonable it is to feel unnecessary anxiety leading to depression. And things were better.

column1: The reason I stopped taking celexa is because it caused SEVERE MEMORY LOSS. It started small. I couldn't remember what happened yesterday. Then
column2: after month two
column3: I couldn't remember conversations people would tell me I had with them. And at the end of month three
column4: I was standing in front of a desk somewhere  (I don't even remember where I was) with a woman in front of me asking me what my name was. I stared blankly at her. I couldn't remember. I apologized and had to pull out my wallet and look at my drivers license to remember my middle name. I then began researching the drug and discovered that memory loss is a common side affect. I immediately stopped taking it
column5: but it still took me about 3 months for my memory to return to normal. But on a positive note
column6: it  feels back to normal now (about 1 year later) I apologized to my friends and let them know what I was going through
column7: and surprisingly
column8: one of my friends who I've known to have memory problems told me that he was taking the same medication. He ended up cutting his dose in half afterwards and noticed an improvement in memory. I still recommend it as a relief from the pit of anxiety and depression
column9: so you can understand how life should feel
column10: but I would never recommend it long term. Use the time on it to learn how to live."

A year ago I found out that getting testosterone injections was far more effective and less expensive than androgen.  by then I was hooked on Celexa/Citalopram. column2: meaning to increase to 20 after a week (it was to be taken right before bedtime because of drowsiness).  I stopped taking it after 5 days.  I was prescribed this medication in order to combat grief symptoms and anxiety after the death of both of my parents.  I had high hopes
column3: as I had never been on an anti-depressant and was hoping this might make me feel like ""me"" again so that I could do everyday activities without getting stressed and exhausted.  It did improve my quality of sleep and I woke up refreshed and energized
column4: but I would ""crash"" later in the day
column5: a few hours before I was to take my next dose.  It was how I imagine a drug user's ""highs"" and ""lows"" to be

column7: and because of this I probably should have told someone I was taking it (I meant for my use of this drug to be private).  Nothing I would act on

column5: the increased dosage hasn't helped my depression or anxiety.  I also was camping in the jungle in Central America and forgot to bring enough Celexa with me.  I was without it for about 4 days and the withdrawal was HORRIBLE.  I was dizzy and confused and my face went numb!  Overall

column19: I wouldn't have been here today writing this really

column2: long story) and tapered myself off (the non-generic Celexa was very expensive.)

column3: I really didn't see it.

column1: Recently and after a case of the shingles
column2: several rounds of cold and flu
column3: and an inner ear infection that took away my equilibrium...

column1: Some family members sat me down and told me they were very concerned that stress and depression were ruining my health and for what might happen to me...
I went to my Dr and got a prescription for the new generic form.

A-D's are serious drugs and can have serious side effects
column2: if a prescription does not help or generates overtly negative effects
column3: run back to your Dr and change something. I have a family member who had to go through 4 different drugs before the 5th one did the trick"

1868$Depression$4/19/2013 11:39:09 AM$Reviewer: Dave56, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$4$I was on Celexa for about a month. Two weeks in I started having stomach pain and bleeding issues on 10 mg. Told my doctor, she couldn't believe it and brushed me off. When I ramped up to 20 mg it really got bad. Stomach pain, nausea, loss of appetite and major bleeding issues. After getting only five hours of sleep in a thirty hour period, I started to taper off to 10 mg. Bleeding issues aren't as bad, sleep issues are better but I still have nausea and I don't feel hungry. I have to use the clock to tell me it is time to eat. Today I start the 5 mg dose and see doctor tomorrow, (she mentioned something about trying Lexapro when I called in with issues.). I tried taking it with food, no help. So I take it in the evening with dinner. My sleep meds are now working again. Hope that the nausea goes away. Evadently I am very sensitive to medications as I have had issued with seven anti-depresants now.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$I had been through months of chemo and then had surgery. My family and my surgeon felt I was not acting happy enough that the cancer was gone and were concerned that I was still sad over losing my breast and still needing pain meds (even though I was down to half doses). I was prescribed 10 mg. I was so nauseated I could not eat
column3: couldn't stay awake during the day
column4: and finally started being awakened multiple times at night with panic attacks
column5: which was the end of my taking it. First day off had major headache
column6: after that I was back to myself. I unfortunately learned to limit sharing my pain at my loss to my support group and my journal
column7: but my family was convinced the antidepressant was working until they found out I hadn't taken it for a week. I am now hearing that the few days I was on it must have really helped me for over a week and am being pressured to go back on it or get a different one. Even if I hadn't had side effects
column8: I think the real problem in my case was (and is) that there are people in my life who are not willing to give me time to heal emotionally
column9: although they are very supportive of my need to heal physically. Perhaps the side effects even saved me from a worse problem of trying to get off it later. I think doctors are too quick to reach for the prescription pad
column10: especially if depression is clearly situational. Counseling and acceptance (and maybe some hugs) would have been better.

After about two months this side effect increased along with loss of libido and trouble sleeping.  My thoughts became racing and my memory was decreasing each day.  My doctor tried increasing my dose, but eventually decreased my dosage then discontinued.  The Celexa alone worked better for my condition.  I was told that Abilify compliments the effect of Celexa when take together.

2056$Depression$5/10/2012 9:36:06 AM$Reviewer: joya, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$5$Depression/anxiety issues run in my family. After nearly 20 years of talk therapy --and a very toxic work environment --my new MD prescribed Celexa (I'm on generic form). It worked almost immediately for me --my anger, anxiety and apathy lessened, and my obsessive worries are nearly gone. Only side effect has been headaches and increased appetite (salty carbs and sugar). I can't drink any alcohol on it (that's fine). The benefits far outweigh the side effects! I wish that I had been less averse to taking medications; my anxiety & depression has been a constant battle since age 19. 
2057$Depression$5/9/2012 10:21:50 PM$Reviewer: redvickie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$3$Celexa was given to me because the medication I was taking (Cymbalta) was too expensive and insurance would no longer pay.

column3: forgot to take it for 2 weeks and I then tried to commit suicide. I was put back on it at 40 mgs had another episode wanted to commit suicide so I was given med too. column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver) $2$1$5$"My wife has been on Celexa since 2004 and it helped with her depression till about 2008. She was started on 20 mgs then 40
column3: then 50
column4: then 60 and he wanted to take her to 80!  About 1 1/2 years ago I notice a change in her behavior.  My wife of 47 years was getting more distant and showed little or no affection.  Our relations are 0 now and we had always had a very affectionate and warm relationship
column5: and that was gone.  The day it came to a head I put my arms around her in the kitchen one morning to give her a hug and she stood there like she was a robot with no feeling.  It hit me so hard for the rest of that day I though I would die of a broken heart.  This is when I started to to use Web MD to look into the meds that she was taking and found our what was going on because of the Celexa.  I talked to her Psychiatrist and he told me in so may words it wasn't any of my business and my wife was his patient.  ""What the heck about our marriage""?  I trusted these doctors and I feel they have made a bigger mess of my wife then when she started her treatment for depression.  I am glad after we had talked the doctor has changed her to Lexapro with Wellbutrin and the fog seems to be lifting
column6: but she has a long way to go to get back to her normal self.  I feel that before our spouses are put on these medications the family members need to be brought in
column7: and helped to understand what they need to do to be the support structure for the depressed member.  If the member getting the help loses the love and support of the spouse it will make things much worse for the for the marriage an relationship. I would like to see the family member have several sections together and maybe work through the depression if possible before the SSRI medications are prescribed
column8: I feel that the patient becomes addicted to these medications.  I love my wife very much after all of these years and I wish I would have been included with the therapy that she was being prescribed and not pushed on the side."

2079$Depression$3/29/2012 5:06:55 AM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was given 60mg of Celexa for years...about 6 years ago I cut down to 40mg and had no problems.  Recently I spoke to my doctor about cutting out the medication but was advised to continue until at least spring.  An abscessed tooth and pain medication Nabumatone made me stop taking it...the medication instructions said specifically do not take one with the other.  It has been about 8 days and the only withdrawal symptom has been slight nausea.  I have sleep apnea and have struggled for years despite using a CPAP...strangely enough going off the Celexa has enabled me to sleep better and have more energy during the day.  Makes me go hmmmmmm.....

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$4$This is only day 2 of taking this drug (20mg) but I wanted to share with the community how it is making me feel so that it may help others make an informed decision. I am a male
column4: weigh 195lbs
column5: with a very high metabolism. Diagnosed with GAD back in 2001 after a panic attack / excessive sweating (Hyperhidrosis) / general feeling that something bad was gonna happen (post 9/11?). Anxiety / Depression are in my family history. I have been taking .25mg of xanax as needed during this period of time with good results. After getting a new (and very stressful) job in May
column6: it didn't take long for my anxiety disorder to intensify and lead to a higher level of depression
column7: with the first ever suicidal thoughts coming over the holiday break. The stress of the ridiculous unrealistic expectations of my employer combined with the responsibility that if I mess up our soldiers lives are at risk was too much to bare. I began double dosing my xanax just to get thru the work day and drinking heavily after work almost daily. Mood swings were out of control and I would just cry. Decided to go on LOA and spoke with my PCP about my issues. She prescribed the Celexa and asked me to go back to taking the .25 xanax as needed instead of daily. I also began seeing a counselor who agreed with the PCP about trying Celexa. After my first dose yesterday I almost instantly felt some side effects. Nausea
column8: stomach pains (mild)
column9: light-headed
column10: excessive yawning
column11: dry and bad taste in my mouth
column12: shortness of breathe
column13: and sweating of hands / feet / underarms is on a new level. Also feel lethargic and like a zombie. I will post again in a few weeks once I have more experience with the drug.

column3: unmotivated
column4: and lack of energy

column6: and I found myself being forgetfull.  I also was experiencing a decrease interest in sex.  When I switched to Celexa those side effects disappeared.  I found myself being more motivated

i began using Lexapro due to a lot of anxiety and mild depression.  I fought through the earlier side-effects (jitteriness
column2: clenching my jaws
column3: some suicidal thoughts but not intense) and then began feeling better (more relaxed and not dwelling on particular negative thoughts).  After a couple of years
column4: I reduced dose from 10mg to 5mg.  After 3-4 years at 5mg

column1: I then weaned myself off over a six month period.  Within a few weeks
column2: I felt very irritable and a little out of control
column3: emotionally.  My wife sent me back to the doctor and was prescribed Celexa 20mg.  It helped immediately.  I've taken it for the past year without any noticable side-effects.  I'm 58 and very active.  I do go to the local YMCA about 5 days a week and run about 15 miles a week on the treadmill as well as using other exercise equipment.  I am a big advocate of using exercise to treat anxiety and depression.  Celexa and exercise has been a good combination for me.  I had always been fit and trim before my son died.  I gained about 15 pounds and had trouble being focused to lose weight.  During the past year I have lost 15 pounds and feel much
column4: much better.  I won't give Celexa all of the credit
column5: but I think it has helped.  I would recommend it for mild/moderate depression and anxiety."

column5: arms
column6: legs
column7: and in my hairline.  The itching is unbearable and predisone did not relieve it.  In reading these posts
column8: I read one from the woman whose sister committed suicide while on Celexa and that Celexa had become toxic because she had been dieting and her protein levels were low.  I believe that the Celexa became toxic in my system. Tell your doctor if you are dieting prior to taking this drug and be careful.  Celexa also made me like a zombie.

2314$Depression$5/13/2011 1:20:18 PM$Reviewer: Tegan, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$4$   I am a seventeen year old male and was perscribed Celexa after being on a different antidepressent called Zoloft (which also did not work for me). I have been taking the medication for about two months and felt the drug working very early on. I can personally say that the drug has made me feel even more depressed at times. My anxiety has also worsened and have since developed a major fear of panic attacks (which have occured in the past). I have experienced feelings of hopelessness and the feeling that I will never have another happy experience again.

The drug has also seemed to have a negative affect on my sleeping patterns. I often wake up many times throughout the night and sometimes have trouble falling back asleep on account of sad or depressing thoughts and feelings.
My experiences with this drug has proved to me that all antidepressants do not work for everyone. There is still a chance that the drug will worsen your depression. "

2492$Depression$10/31/2010 1:45:42 PM$Reviewer: Omega1697, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I started taking Celexa 20mg (generic citalopram, its a lot cheaper) The first week of August this year. I was diagnosed with Major Depression and Generalized Anxiety Disorder. I take it once a day at night (with food to diminish any possible gastrointestinal side effects). I am feeling 100% better than I did just a few months ago. I could not be more satisfied with the outcome. Before, I could not sleep or focus on anything. I was nauseas and exhausted all of the time and I even felt so dizzy I couldnt drive or go to class. I am now falling asleep without the help of sleep-aids. I have energy again; I no longer sleep 8 hours and wake up feeling more exhausted than I did the night before. FOR ME this was the correct medication. NO MEDICATION IS CORRECT FOR EVERYONE. There are several negative reviews from individuals; take them with a grain of salt. Yes, the first week can be miserable on a new anti-depressant (you have serotonin receptors all over your body, including your brain, blood vessels and stomach. While your body is adjusting to the new levels of serotonin, you will probably feel nauseas and have a headache). You have to be patient though! After a week I could feel a difference, and after a month I felt great. I feel like my old self again. The only downside I can find with the drug is that I cannot drink AT ALL on this drug. As with most SSRIs, alcohol renders the medication ineffective because Alcohol occupies the same receptors in your body. Massive panic attacks came for an entire week after drinking moderately. I would happily give up alcohol for the rest of my life to NEVER feel the depression and anxiety ever again though. There are also sexual side effects, but for me they have been positive. I can now maintain an erection and have a healthy sex life. I also have no problem with having orgasms. Do not rule out any drug because of the reviews on here. Eventually, you WILL find the right drug for you :). HANG IN THERE!!

column1:
2626$Depression$7/16/2010 11:51:11 AM$Reviewer: beth, 35-44 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication has been the only drug that has ever even touched me for the better. I used to think Paxil worked because I didnt know how much better it could be with celexa but almost immediately I felt like a new and improved girl. I never had a major depressive episode just an underlying dysthymia(low level depression)since high school. I always thought that I was just unhappy and that was that. About 6 years ago I started taking celexa after lexapro made me have zero improvement. The rest is history. The most wonderful drug in the world. Did gain about 10 pounds but that was the beginning and I would rather be 10 pounds heavier and happier then 10 pounds thinner and miserable. Now Im the thinnest I've ever been. I came to the conclusion that when you start taking the celexa you relax and arent as crazy about being a half a pound more. I always thought the other drugs I took(paxil, prozac, zoloft, wellbutrin, lexapro, buspar were working because I used to talk myself into the fact that I felt better when I felt no change. Celexa changed my life and showed me that its ok to try different drug and treatment modalities until something works because this is your life. You are worth it. Being happy is something we all(or at least I)was willing to give-up because I thought something was wrong with me because I never had much of an effect from anything. Take care people and take the time to find something that will help you!
2629$Depression$7/15/2010 2:30:57 PM$Reviewer: Amylein17, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I am taking 20 mg of generic Celexa and have been for a little over a month. I have improved concentration, am not tired all the time, the negative thoughts have stopped and I laugh again. Life has improved greatly since I've started taking it.

2646$Depression$7/3/2010 11:33:38 AM$Reviewer: Piece of Work, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$3 yrs ago in the midst of an event-induced depression & anxiety, 1st tried Zoloft; no help. Then citalopram (generic) at 20mg.  Almost immediate relief (but event soon concluded, too).  That said, the spiraling, out-of-control despair, dread & nausea stopped.  With citalopram, it felt like I was blocked from obsessing about the recent unendurable concerns (I'll get cancer like my mother, the world is full of incomprehensible suffering, even if things are good for a time they won't last, there's no joy...)-- either I couldn't focus on them anymore or I was on a track where I could not derail into despair.  At the same time, sexual interest declined and even when aroused, I couldn't climax.    BTW, husband has urged me NOT to go off drug.  He said he'd rather give up sex than have to go through my being depressed again!  Dr suggested reducing amount to 5 mg/day.  Sex now is usually better but still infrequent.  Realize menopause could be responsible, too, not to mention boring old routines of a 25 year marriage!  Weight gain-- a little.  Could be menopause, too.   Then again, if the effect of citalopram is to prevent focus on the negative, it stands to reason that it would prevent focus on the positive (sex, getting things accomplished).  There are always trade-offs.

2960$Depression$10/5/2009 6:18:44 AM$Reviewer: caz, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$5$Took cipramil (celexa brand name in the UK) for 2 years. A littel advertised side effect is ""disinhibition"". This caused me to make inappropriate comments and swear more etc...very weird! Unfortunately I lost my job over it before I discovered the cause and stopped taking the drug. When I stopped I found I was not depressed as badly as when I was on it and the anxiety had gone as well... this drug can be useful for short term use prior to counselling to deal with rather than bury the issues. I was also suffering from what is quaintly called ""suicidal ideation"" as I was convinced my family would be better off without me...really bad shit I think you'll agree! The reason for the disinhibition is that serotonin (which this drug increases in the brain to make you happier allegedly) is involved in your internal behaviour regulation. Really look out for this and the suicidal thoughts if you are taking this stuff esp long term.. at least it didn'tmake me sweat as much as Prozac did! good luck out there everyone."

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$3$"After taking Celexa for just a couple of weeks

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$1$5$"I've had (undiagnosed) chronic depression as an ongoing background for years. Then last year I landed in a terrible work environment and chose to leave it
column3: in a way that ended rather traumatically. I went to consulting and the shrink freaked out saying I am so depressed I must go on meds now. I was hardly sleeping every night.

column1: I went to my M.D. who was also enthusiastic about the treatment. ""You will still be yourself""
column2: he said. He chose Celexa and put me on a very low dose (10 mg).
I bought a month's worth and took it... for six days. Yes
column3: the pain and self-immolation inside my mind were numbed. BUT The last thing I can say is that I was myself. I was definitely NOT.

column2: off and running as soon as the alarm goes and sometimes a bit before that on most days; suddenly I would roll around in bed unable to switch my mind on for an hour.

column1: - My sexual appetite is quite healthy and wide-ranging. Overnight it was simply gone. I had never felt anything like it.
- Perhaps worst of all: I am a researcher. I use my brain for a living. I write research articles. But suddenly
column2: by brain became a fuzzball. I could not think for one minute straight. Not because I had other stuff on my mind; because it became a fuzzball.

column1: This thing seems to work for other people
column2: maybe they are less sensitive to drugs in general. I know I am
column3: and with all the pain
column4: anger and depression I prefer to be myself than the numb slob I became when on this thing.

column1: The good thing about stopping after such a short while is that the ""chill-off"" period was much shorter. Yet
column2: 3 days after getting off Celexa I had a day of worse depression than I had ever felt. But that was it.

column1: Since then I exercise on a daily basis
column2: put a lot of effort into my research
column3: and try to move my life back on track. It will never be easy - but believing that ""you can take a pill and it will be better"" is in my view no different than becoming a drug addict."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"Depression runs in my family on both sides.  I never knew I was truly depressed until in my late 20's my mother told me that she no longer enjoyed our conversations because I was always such a ""downer"".  My mother and I are very close and I decided right then and there to do something about it.  Zoloft and Prozac did nothing.  Effexor made me extremely sick to my stomach.  Was on Paxil for quite a while until I met my husband and wanted him to know that my lack of sex drive was not related to him. Wellbutrin put me in such a fog I walked around like a zombie
column3: could not control my extremities and felt like my head was floating above my body.  Along came Lexapro and I was saved!!  Something finally worked well with my body chemistry(an my mother's as well) and didn't cause me strange side effects!!  Being that my insurance did not cover it
column4: my doctor put me on Celexa (Lexapro's cousin) and I have never looked back.  I do not ""hide out"" or avoid social situations as much as I used to.  I laugh and love to make people laugh.  People that I confide in about taking an antidepresant can not believe that I actually NEED this.  That is how much this has helped me.  Lastly
column5: the only side effect I get is if I forget to take it for a few days I will cry at the drop of a hat.  I will feel like crying over ANYTHING when I skip a dose/doses.  It is then I know I am off my routine... but no other side effects.  Hope this helps someone else."

column1: 3524$Depression$7/3/2008 12:45:43 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$2$4$"I was taking this medication for 6-7 years for depression.  Instantly
column2: major weight gain occurred and would not come off.  Tired all the time; over time had to increase dosage and then decrease when I got too anxious.  If forgot to take it for a day
column3: sickness (stomach upset
column4: nervousness) would occur.  When I finally decided I did not need it anymore (with my doctor's knowledge); I gradually decreased the dosage.  BE AWARE: There is no going ""cold turkey"" with this medicine; you will become very physically sick if you do.  I gradually cut back 5-10 mg about every three-five months as I could; then at the lowest dose
column5: went every other day until the medication was finished.  The highest I was at was 60 mg.  It took about 2 years to get off the medication.  It was very tough; there was stomach upset; worry; diarhea; cold sweats; felt like my head was ""foggy"".  But it can be done.  If you feel you need to get off this medicine; talk to your doctor and give yourself A LOT of time (gradually; at least a year).  I really think your body and mind become dependent on it.  If I could do it
column6: anyone can.  Best of Luck; be blessed."

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$4$It took quite a while for it to work. I started at 10mg
column3: then uped to 20mg which is what my dr recommended me at. I have had severe depression since before I hit puberty and am now 24
column4: almost 25 (I hit puberty at around 9-10). I suffered through my entire per-adult life and well into the beginning of it. I finally took control iPad started this medication. Talking therapy didn't work. Everything I tried didn't work. Finally
column5: after about 6-8 months on this medication (yes really) I feel fantastic. I've never been happier. I don't remember feeling this great. Its like I actually see colors again. I'm trying to stop this medication now
column6: since I think I can finally deal without it (it's been Bout a year) and I'm having a bit of a difficult time with it though. I'm still feeling good but I get crazy moody bouts of ANGER. I have really no reason to be angry but everything is just enraging!! It's very frustrating. I hope it goes away soon but I would recommend quitting the meds as SLOWLY as possible to fight the mood swings. I had no real side affects on this medication except for craving for sweets and a harder time to orgasm (but when I did it was awesome lol).

1622$Major Depressive Disorder$7/30/2016 10:46:07 PM$Reviewer: Xandria, 25-34 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$1$5$Celexa made me feel flighty for about two weeks and then good.  I felt so good on Celexa that I continued to use it for 11 years.  I use it through two pregnancies.  Now, I have been off of it for about 45 days.  While on Celexa, I felt fine and things did not bother me much.  My babies, when born, did not cry.  They were the calmest children while breastfed.  Now I wonder what have I done.  I am physical sick every day.  I can not do simple tasks like go grocery shopping or listen to an automated recording on the phone. The migraines are intense and nausea excruciating, irritating, and my overall feeling miserable.  Do Not Take This Drug!  If you are on it, it is time to talk to your doctor about something different.  Take my advice, the shorter the half life of the drug, the better.

1691$Major Depressive Disorder$10/10/2014 11:51:36 AM$Reviewer: Sstyle, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$I have suffered with depression and anxiety since I was 13 and I am now 49. Been in therapy through the years and tried many different medications. I have been taking 20mg Celexa for about 5 months now and I feel better than I can ever remember feeling. I did have constant yawning for the first month, and still do periodically. I take it at night and sleep better than I have in years. Yay for that! I have noticed that I don't feel deeply on this medication (like watching a sad movie where I would normally cry, I don't). It definitely takes the edge off and keeps my mood at a manageable level so I can deal with the difficulties life throws at me. Another thing I would suggest is something called Mindfullness Training. I am also doing that through the Veterans Administration and it is extremely helpful with interpersonal communications with family, friends, kids, and work relationships.

column1: 1892$Major Depressive Disorder$3/7/2013 5:05:24 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$5$I was prescribed Celexa 20mg daily after inpatient treatment for clinical depression & suicidal ideation. Prior to hospitalization
column2: I was taking Wellbutrin 150mg twice daily. The Celexa has helped immensely with my mood
column3: and it took me only 4 days to start noticing a major difference in how I feel about myself. I am calm
column4: and I feel like I finally have some control over my emotions. I no longer experience random crying episodes & I have a LOT more patience with with family. I used to not even get out of bed. I also seem to handle stressful situations with less anxiety. I have been able to enjoy a few of my old hobbies again. For the first time in over a year
column5: I can see a light at the end of the tunnel. The only side effect I'm experiencing IS LITTLE TO NO INTREST IN SEX. I also have an EXTREMELY hard time achieving orgasm now
column6: and if I am lucky enough to have one
column7: the intensity level is about 2/10
column8: where as before I starting taking this medication
column9: I had a very high sex drive
column10: and no trouble having multiple orgasms with an intensity level of 8-9/10. I am a 37 year old female
column11: in a stable and supportive relationship with a man
column12: and this has been a MAJOR issue with me
column13: since we used to enjoy sex at least twice a day. I know it seems silly to regard sex as being so important. I have a wonderful emotional connection with my partner
column14: but now I am unable to connect with him physically. I plan to talk with my therapist about a possible med change if there is no way to fix the current situation. Other than this one single complaint
column15: (which many people probably wouldn't object to) THIS MEDICATION HAS TRULY WORKED WONDERS
column16: AND I FEEL HOPEFUL ABOUT LIFE AGAIN!!!
